item.title: Talking Newspaper stalwart Joy dies at 101
item.description: Tributes are being paid to Joy, founder of Blackpool's talking newspaper for visually impaired residents, following her death at 101. The service provides audio news to blind and partially sighted people across the Fylde coast. Her dedication ensured Lancashire's visually impaired community stayed informed for decades.

item.title: Government Launch Statutory Consultation on Local Government Reorganisation in Lancashire
item.description: The statutory consultation, launched by the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government (MHCLG), runs from 5 February to 26 March 2026 and invites views on proposals to reorganise local government across Lancashire. This is the last chance for people to share their views on the future of local government structures in Lancashire.

item.title: Lancaster businesses vote ‘yes’ to BID
item.description: Lancaster city centre traders have backed a five-year extension of the Business Improvement District scheme in a recent ballot. The vote secures continued funding for street cleaning, safety patrols and marketing efforts to boost the historic city centre. Local firms will contribute to the initiative through a mandatory levy over the coming term.

The scheme promises vital protection for Burnley borough homes and businesses at risk from rising water levels.
